definitions.definition: A person who is intentionally physically or emotionally cruel to others, especially to those whom they perceive as being vulnerable or of less power or privilege.
examples: A playground bully pushed a girl off the swing.
I noticed you being a bully towards people with disabilities.

definitions.definition: A noisy, blustering, tyrannical person, more insolent than courageous; one who is threatening and quarrelsome .
The small scrum in the Eton College field game .
Any of various small freshwater or brackishwater fish of the family Eleotridae ; sleeper gobies . A common bully , Gobiomorphus cotidianus
An (eldest) brother ; a fellow workman ; comrade
definitions.label_groups: obsolete or dialectal , Ireland and Northern England

definitions.definition: A companion ; mate ( male or female ) .
A darling , sweetheart ( male or female ) .
A standoff between two players from the opposing teams, who repeatedly hit each other's hockey sticks and then attempt to acquire the ball, as a method of resuming the game in certain circumstances.

main_definition: A person who is intentionally physically or emotionally cruel to others, especially to those whom they perceive as being vulnerable or of less power or privilege. [from late 17th c.]
secondary_definitions: A noisy, blustering, tyrannical person, more insolent than courageous; one who is threatening and quarrelsome .
The small scrum in the Eton College field game .
Any of various small freshwater or brackishwater fish of the family Eleotridae ; sleeper gobies . A common bully , Gobiomorphus cotidianus
( obsolete or dialectal , Ireland and Northern England ) An (eldest) brother ; a fellow workman ; comrade
( dialectal ) A companion ; mate ( male or female ) .
( obsolete ) A darling , sweetheart ( male or female ) .

( field hockey ) A standoff between two players from the opposing teams, who repeatedly hit each other's hockey sticks and then attempt to acquire the ball, as a method of resuming the game in certain circumstances.
